intro: Comesperma coridifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
